edu.ucla.sspace.clustering.criterion
Class HybridBaseFunction

java.lang.Object
  edu.ucla.sspace.clustering.criterion.HybridBaseFunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
CriterionFunction
Direct Known Subclasses:
H1Function, H2Function
public abstract class HybridBaseFunction
extends Object
implements CriterionFunction

This CriterionFunction implements the basic functionality needed for a majority of the hybrid functions available. It works by first gathering a handful of meta data for the data set, such as the cluster sizes, initial cluster assignments, and initial centroids. It then implements update and requires subclasses to implement functions for determining the change in the criterion score due to moving a data point. Hybrid CriterionFunctions utilize an internal and external criterion function in order to balance between both objectives in order to create a well balanced clustering.

Author:
Keith Stevens

setup

public void setup(Matrix m,

Creates the cluster centroids and any other meta data needed by this CriterionFunction.

Specified by:
setup in interface CriterionFunction
Parameters:
m - The Matrix holding data points. This will be used as read only.
initialAssignments - The cluster assignments for each data point in m. This is used as read only and discarded.

update

public boolean update(int currentVectorIndex)
Updates the clustering assignment for data point indexed by currentVectorIndex. This returns true if the data point is left in the same cluster and false if it was relocated to another data point.

Specified by:
update in interface CriterionFunction
